Metadata: Careers in Science: Shea Steingass and Alissa Johnson (May 6, 2020 Webinar video)
Oregon Sea Grant; Published on YouTube June 3, 2020
CSI: Careers in Science Investigation Series

Offered by Oregon Sea Grant, this webinar is for students in grades 6-12 who want to explore careers in marine science. Shea Steingass talks about her path from Wyoming to her job as the marine mammal program leader for @myodfw. She describes what marine mammals are and how she has tagged harbor seals to learn more about their health and location. Alissa Johnson shares what it's like to be the chief hydrographic survey  technician on the research ship Fairweather, which is operated by @noaa. Lindsay Carroll, who coordinates Oregon Sea Grant's marine education program, serves as a moderator on this webinar, which was recorded on May 6, 2020.
